intro: Dorystephania luzonensis, commonly known as the Luzon climbing shrub, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its roots and stems are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
